hook.text: Sleeping five hours instead of eight increases daily calorie intake by about 300 calories on average.

buildup.text: Short sleep raises ghrelin, the hunger hormone, and lowers leptin, the satiety hormone. You eat more.

discovery.text: Sleep-deprived brains crave high-calorie, high-sugar foods. The reward system overrides willpower.

twist.text: Dieting without sleep fails. The body loses muscle instead of fat when rest is insufficient.

climax.text: Fixing sleep is often more effective than fixing diet. The hormones that control hunger start in bed.

punchline.text: Want to lose weight? Start by sleeping more.

quiz.question: What hormone increases when you're sleep-deprived?
